dc_title_s: Child Mental Health Providers: Washington, D.C., United States
dc_description_s: Child (Community-based) Mental Health Service ProvidersThe Department of Behavioral Health ensures that high quality mental health services are available to District residents through a rigorous certification program conducted by the Office of Accountability. DBH certifies a provider to deliver services that support individual recovery with qualified, culturally competent staff in a safe facility. A provider also must comply with local and federal rules and regulations. Only a certified provider is eligible to participate in the District s public behavioral health system. Services include diagnostic assessment, medication, counseling and community support. METADATA CONTENT IS IN PROCESS OF VALIDATION AND SUBJECT TO CHANGE.
